newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil stocks end slightly off, volume shrinks.
newsitem.headline: Brazil stocks end slightly off, volume shrinks.

text.p: Brazilian stocks ended slightly lower on profit-taking in thinner volume, brokers said.
The Bovespa index .BVSP of the 48 most traded stocks closed off 0.69 percent at 12,121 points.
Market turnover was 795.09 million reais ($743 million), below the bolsa's daily average of over one billion reais in recent sessions.
Benchmark Telebras preferred fell 0.95 percent to 155.70 reais at the close. Private miner Vale do Rio Doce lost 1.62 percent, ending at 23.70 reais.

Brokers said a lack of market-moving news helped slow activity in the bolsa Friday. They expect trade to improve next week if local equity funds continue to pour fresh money into the market. Domestic equity funds have been the primary motor of the bolsa's recent rally.
